00026 /*************************************************************************
00027  Initialization of the I2C bus interface. Need to be called only once
00028 *************************************************************************/
00029 void i2c_init(void)
00030 {
00031   /* initialize TWI clock: 100 kHz clock, TWPS = 0 => prescaler = 1 */
00032         DDRD |= (1<<PD7);
00033     PORTD |= (1<<PD7); 
00034     
00035     TWSR = 0;                         /* no prescaler */
00036     TWBR = ((F_CPU/SCL_CLOCK)-16)/2;  /* must be > 10 for stable operation */
00037 
00038 }/* i2c_init */

00041 /*************************************************************************      
00042   Issues a start condition and sends address and transfer direction.
00043   return 0 = device accessible, 1= failed to access device
00044 *************************************************************************/
00045 unsigned char i2c_start(unsigned char address)
00046 {
00047     uint8_t   twst;
00048 
00049         // send START condition
00050         TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWSTA) | (1<<TWEN);
00051 
00052         // wait until transmission completed
00053         while(!(TWCR & (1<<TWINT)));
00054 
00055         // check value of TWI Status Register. Mask prescaler bits.
00056         twst = TW_STATUS & 0xF8;
00057         if ( (twst != TW_START) && (twst != TW_REP_START)) return 1;
00058 
00059         // send device address
00060         TWDR = address;
00061         TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWEN);
00062 
00063         // wail until transmission completed and ACK/NACK has been received
00064         while(!(TWCR & (1<<TWINT)));
00065 
00066         // check value of TWI Status Register. Mask prescaler bits.
00067         twst = TW_STATUS & 0xF8;
00068         if ( (twst != TW_MT_SLA_ACK) && (twst != TW_MR_SLA_ACK) ) return 2;
00069 
00070         return 0;
00071 
00072 }/* i2c_start */
00073

00075 /*************************************************************************
00076  Issues a start condition and sends address and transfer direction.
00077  If device is busy, use ack polling to wait until device is ready
00078  
00079  Input:   address and transfer direction of I2C device
00080 *************************************************************************/
00081 int i2c_start_wait(unsigned char address)
00082 {
00083     uint8_t   twst;
00084     int Try=0;
00085 
00086     while ( 1 )
00087     {
00088         Try++;
00089         if(Try>10)
00090             return -1;
00091             // send START condition
00092             TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWSTA) | (1<<TWEN);
00093     
00094         // wait until transmission completed
00095         while(!(TWCR & (1<<TWINT)));
00096     
00097         // check value of TWI Status Register. Mask prescaler bits.
00098         twst = TW_STATUS & 0xF8;
00099         if ( (twst != TW_START) && (twst != TW_REP_START)) continue;
00100     
00101         // send device address
00102         TWDR = address;
00103         TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWEN);
00104     
00105         // wail until transmission completed
00106         while(!(TWCR & (1<<TWINT)));
00107     
00108         // check value of TWI Status Register. Mask prescaler bits.
00109         twst = TW_STATUS & 0xF8;
00110         if ( (twst == TW_MT_SLA_NACK )||(twst ==TW_MR_DATA_NACK) ) 
00111         {           
00112             /* device busy, send stop condition to terminate write operation */
00113                 TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWEN) | (1<<TWSTO);
00114                 
00115                 // wait until stop condition is executed and bus released
00116                 while(TWCR & (1<<TWSTO));
00117                 
00118             continue;
00119         }
00120         //if( twst != TW_MT_SLA_ACK) return 1;
00121         break;
00122      }
00123      return 0;
00124 
00125 }/* i2c_start_wait */

00136 unsigned char i2c_rep_start(unsigned char address)

00143 /*************************************************************************
00144  Terminates the data transfer and releases the I2C bus
00145 *************************************************************************/
00146 void i2c_stop(void)
00147 {
00148     /* send stop condition */
00149         TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWEN) | (1<<TWSTO);
00150         
00151         // wait until stop condition is executed and bus released
00152         while(TWCR & (1<<TWSTO));
00153 
00154 }/* i2c_stop */

00157 /*************************************************************************
00158   Send one byte to I2C device
00159   
00160   Input:    byte to be transfered
00161   Return:   0 write successful 
00162             1 write failed
00163 *************************************************************************/
00164 unsigned char i2c_write( unsigned char data )
00165 {       
00166     uint8_t   twst;
00167     
00168         // send data to the previously addressed device
00169         TWDR = data;
00170         TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWEN);
00171 
00172         // wait until transmission completed
00173         while(!(TWCR & (1<<TWINT)));
00174 
00175         // check value of TWI Status Register. Mask prescaler bits
00176         twst = TW_STATUS & 0xF8;
00177         if( twst != TW_MT_DATA_ACK) return 1;
00178         return 0;
00179 
00180 }/* i2c_write */

00183 /*************************************************************************
00184  Read one byte from the I2C device, request more data from device 
00185  
00186  Return:  byte read from I2C device
00187 *************************************************************************/
00188 unsigned char i2c_readAck(void)
00189 {
00190         TWCR = (1<<TWINT) | (1<<TWEN) | (1<<TWEA);
00191         while(!(TWCR & (1<<TWINT)));    
00192 
00193     return TWDR;

00203 unsigned char i2c_readNak(void)
